answers.answer: Breast milk strengthens the child's immunity and provides all necessary substances for the baby, offering full health protection. It is also the most convenient and safest way to feed a child.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'Breastfeeding'.

answers.answer: Stressful situations do not affect milk production or quality, but in rare cases, stress may slow down the flow of milk.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'Breastfeeding'.

answers.answer: Experts recommend feeding the baby on demand, as often as the child wants, but at least 8-12 times a day.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'Breastfeeding'.

answers.answer: To maintain lactation when separated from the baby, mothers should continue to drain milk with their hands or a breast pump, following the usual number of feedings.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'What if your baby can't breastfed or he is not with you'.

answers.answer: To restore breast milk supply, mothers should try to restore the usual milk return, put the baby to the breast often, drink more water, massage the neck area, get enough rest, take a warm shower if possible, and eat well.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'What to do if you cannot continue breastfeeding'.

answers.answer: Babies under 6 months can be fed ready-to-use commercial or generic formula that is suitable for their age, with ready-to-use liquid formula being preferable and safest.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'If you can not restore lactation'.

answers.answer: To prepare dry infant formula safely, boil water at a temperature above 70 degrees Celsius to kill bacteria, and do not prepare the formula in advance.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'If you can not restore lactation'.

answers.answer: If feeding formula to a baby, do not use bottles; instead, use a cup as it is easier to clean and helps prevent illness from dirty bottles.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'If you can not restore lactation'.

answers.answer: Children older than six months can be fed animal milk, such as cow's or goat's milk (including ultra-pasteurized), and complementary foods.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'If you can not restore lactation'.

answers.answer: For emergencies, drinking water should be stored in closed containers, and if stored for a long time, it should be disinfected.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'Water'.

answers.answer: Good foods for emergencies include ready-to-eat products that don't require refrigeration, such as bread, cookies, crackers, canned goods, nuts, seeds, dried fruits, energy bars, apples, bananas, salt, sugar, fats, and sports nutrition products. For young children, instant cereals, mashed meat, fish, and vegetables are recommended.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'Food on the go'.

answers.answer: The Support for refugee women program helps guide individuals experiencing breastfeeding difficulties or those seeking information about breastfeeding towards counselling and prenatal education services in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'Difficulties with breastfeeding?'.

answers.answer: The Romanian Association of Consultants in Lactation and the Association of Independent Midwives provide phone and free online telemedicine consultations in English or with Ukrainian translation, for refugee pregnant women, breastfeeding women, and mothers with infants or children from Ukraine.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'IMPORTANT'.

answers.answer: Lactation support in Romania can be reached by calling +40725278273.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'IMPORTANT'.

answers.answer: A child under the age of two can be fed exclusively breast milk to save his life if there is no access to any other food.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/childrens-nutrition and read the section under 'Why it is especially important to continue breastfeeding in an emergency'.
